cab.content: (P 4705) From Viceroy, Foreign Department, llth August 1919.(Received 11th, 7 p.m.)Clear the line.1162 S. Secret. Afghanistan. Following from Roos-Keppel, dated .10th August: " Afridis are much impressed by news of,peace with Afghanistan. Malik Khan Bahadur Zaman Khan Kuki (corrupt group) has visited Political Agent on behalf of tribe to ask for orders of Government regarding deserters. He has been told that the first thing to do is to recover and send in deserter's rifles, and Afridis have already begun to do so. Before news of peace was received, Afridis had sent a definite refusal to Mullah Mahmud Akhundzada, who had invited them to join his lashkar. No other news ; all quiet."
